dataset.description:
For expenditures prior to July 1, 2014, please visit this dataset: http://controllerdata.lacity.org/resource/f2ec-m4t9

Beginning in 2014, each Neighborhood Council has been given a checking account as part of a new funding model for NC's. This dataset contains the information about each Neighborhood Council's expenditures from those checking accounts. For more information, see the User Guide here: http://empowerla.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/NC-Checking-Account-Core-Guide-7-1-14-1.pdf
dataset.title: Neighborhood Council Checking Account Expenditures

dataset.description: Current as of June 30, 2015. This dataset does not include the City's proprietary departments (Airports, Department of Water and Power, and Harbor).
dataset.title: Outstanding City Bonds

dataset.description:
Balance of all Funds for the City of Los Angeles. Includes General Fund, Reserve Fund, Budget Stabilization Fund, and Special Funds.

Includes descriptions, but does not include financial data for Fire and Police Pensions, City Employees' Retirement Systems, and the Departments of Water and Power, Harbor and Airports since these departments utilize their own financial systems and prepare independent financial statements, which are available on their websites.
dataset.title: Balance of All City Funds

dataset.description: Audits Released by the City Controller since 1999
dataset.title: Audits

dataset.description:
Shows the balance of the City's Reserve Fund, including transfers in and transfers out, beginning in Fiscal Year 1998-1999. The Reserve Fund is an important part of the City's financial health, and is relied on in the event of a natural disaster or other crisis situation.

The City's current policy is to maintain a minimum Reserve Fund balance of 5% of General Fund receipts.
dataset.title: Year Start Reserve Fund Balances

dataset.description: What We Buy
dataset.title: What We Buy

dataset.description:
CAFR Page 359.

Last Ten Fiscal Years.
dataset.title: Demographic and Economic Statistics

dataset.description: City Controller Ron Galperin released an audit that indicated the Los Angeles’ Department of Animal Services is making progress toward its goal of making Los Angeles a “No Kill” City. Still, last year about one of every four lost or abandoned animals that entered the City’s shelters were euthanized. View the department's raw data on each of the City's six animal shelters below.
dataset.title: Every Animal Counts

dataset.description: City Budget, Adjustments and Expenditures since Budget Fiscal Year 2012. Financial data is shown by Budget Fiscal Year.
dataset.title: City Budget Expenditures

dataset.description: Ledger transactions for the City's appropriations, expenditures and revenues are shown in this dataset.
dataset.title: Appropriations, Expenditures and Revenues

dataset.description:
Payroll information for all Los Angeles City Departments since 2011. Data for calendar years, updated on a quarterly basis by the Los Angeles City Controller's Office.

Breakouts for overtime, bonuses, healthcare costs and lump sump payouts begin in 2013.
dataset.title: Payroll

dataset.description: A database of audits completed by the Internal Audit section of the Department of Water and Power (DWP). These audits are not validated or verified by the Controller's Internal Audit Division, and represent the work of auditors directly employed by the DWP.
dataset.title: DWP Audits

dataset.description:
Data since July 1, 2014. This dataset describes the various pay codes which make up the complex compensation of employees of the City's Department of Water and Power (DWP). The Category field indicates which column of the DWP Payroll dataset (https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/DWP-Payroll/fq29-mxsy) that particular pay code relates to.

Pay codes are governed by the Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) between the DWP and its labor representatives; State, City and Federal law; and Departmental policy.
dataset.title: Department of Water and Power (DWP) Pay Codes

dataset.description:
A listing of the different "bonus codes" that supplement the pay of City employees, not including DWP. DWP Pay Codes are available here: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/Department-of-Water-and-Power-DWP-Pay-Codes/jwzw-nd84

The Category field indicates which column of the Payroll dataset (https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/Payroll/8hc2-qe2x) that particular pay code relates to. Pay codes are governed by the Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) between the City and its labor representatives; State, City and Federal law; and Departmental policy.
dataset.title: City Bonus Codes

dataset.description: Payroll Calendar for the City of Los Angeles since 2013.
dataset.title: Los Angeles City Payroll Calendar

dataset.description: Data for the Open Payroll application. Contains detailed information about the earnings and positions of City employees across all Departments. Data begins in 2013.
dataset.title: Los Angeles City Payroll by Employee

dataset.description: For an interactive view of this data, visit http://www.controlpanel.la/cafr/. This dataset includes metrics collected by the Controller's office as part of the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report (CAFR). Metrics are provided by the various departments and each department is responsible for the accuracy of their individual metrics.
dataset.title: Operating Indicators

dataset.description:
Conference and meeting expenditure details for the Joint Safety Institute and the Joint Training Institute. 

Financial documents and underlying data relating to City Controller Ron Galperin's audits of two trusts, the Joint Training Institute and the Joint Safety Institute. The two trusts are fully funded by the Department of Water and Power (DWP) and managed by an appointed board made up of equal numbers of representatives from DWP management and from the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) Local 18, which represents the majority of workers at the DWP. All information below was compiled by the City's auditors for these two audits. For more information, visit: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Audits-and-Reports/Joint-Training-Institute-JTI-and-Joint-Safety-Inst/4i3e-krmq
dataset.title: JTI JSI Conference and Meeting Expenditures By Type

dataset.description:
Click here to read the audit: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/views/4i3e-krmq/files/wE3nyRBxhBYswdaB_m7JHiWwQINaHg3myUQ1TUflZkg?filename=JTI%20JSI%20FINAL%20AUDIT.pdf&content_type=application/pdf%3B%20charset%3Dbinary

Financial documents and underlying data relating to City Controller Ron Galperin's audits of two trusts, the Joint Training Institute and the Joint Safety Institute, which are fully funded by the Department of Water and Power (DWP) and managed by a board made up of equal numbers of representatives from the City and from the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) Local 18, which represents the majority of workers at the DWP. All financial documents and data are audit documents created directly by the City auditor.
dataset.title: Joint Training Institute (JTI) and Joint Safety Institute (JSI) Audit Documents

dataset.description:
Credit card statements and transaction details for the Joint Safety Institute and the Joint Training Institute. 

Financial documents and underlying data relating to City Controller Ron Galperin's audits of two trusts, the Joint Training Institute and the Joint Safety Institute. The two trusts are fully funded by the Department of Water and Power (DWP) and managed by an appointed board made up of equal numbers of representatives from DWP management and from the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) Local 18, which represents the majority of workers at the DWP. All information below was compiled by the City's auditors for these two audits. For more information, visit: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Audits-and-Reports/Joint-Training-Institute-JTI-and-Joint-Safety-Inst/4i3e-krmq
dataset.title: Joint Training Institute (JTI) and Joint Safety Institute (JSI) Credit Card Expenditures

dataset.title: DWP Trending Charts

dataset.description:
The ledger of assets, revenues, and accounts for the Joint Safety Institute and the Joint Training Institute.

Financial documents and underlying data relating to City Controller Ron Galperin's audits of two trusts, the Joint Training Institute and the Joint Safety Institute. The two trusts are fully funded by the Department of Water and Power (DWP) and managed by an appointed board made up of equal numbers of representatives from DWP management and from the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) Local 18, which represents the majority of workers at the DWP. All information below was compiled by the City's auditors for these two audits.

For more information, visit: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Audits-and-Reports/Joint-Training-Institute-JTI-and-Joint-Safety-Inst/4i3e-krmq
dataset.title: Joint Training Institute (JTI) and Joint Safety Institute (JSI) Financial Data

dataset.description:
CAFR Pages 332-335.

Net Position is the difference between the City’s assets and liabilities, including deferred outflows/inflows of resources. This data summarizes the change in Net Position by Change Types, Asset Types, and Activities. This data is based on the following parameters: Accrual Basis of Accounting, Last Ten Fiscal Years and (amounts expressed in thousands).
dataset.title: Changes in Net Position

dataset.title: Changes in Fund Balances - Governmental Funds

dataset.description:
CAFR Pages 338-339.

This data set shows the balance of Governmental Funds by Fiscal Year, Fund Type and Fund Restriction. A Fund is a fiscal entity with revenues and expenditures that are segregated for carrying out a specific purpose or activity. This data is based on the following parameters: Accrual Basis of Accounting, Last Ten Fiscal Years and (amounts expressed in thousands).
dataset.title: Fund Balances - Governmental Funds

dataset.description:
CAFR Pages 330-331.

Net Position is the difference between the City’s assets and liabilities, including deferred outflows/inflows of resources. This data summarizes Net Position by Activity Types, Asset Type Groups, and Asset Types. This data is based on the following parameters: Accrual Basis of Accounting, Last Ten Fiscal Years and (amounts expressed in thousands).
dataset.title: Net Position by Category

dataset.description:
CAFR Page 346.

Last Ten Fiscal Years (amounts expressed in thousands).
dataset.title: Property Tax Levies and Collections

dataset.description:
CAFR Page 344.

Tax Rate Area No. 4(a). Last Ten Fiscal Years.
(a) Tax Rate Area # 4 is used to illustrate the breakdown of a tax rate within the City and applies to most properties within the City of Los Angeles. Since each property is subject to taxation by a number of taxing entities, the County groups all properties subject to taxation by the same entities into Tax Rate Areas (TRAs). There are over 274 TRAs in the City.
dataset.title: Direct and Overlapping Property Tax Rates
